name: Li Bai
description: Tang Dynasty Chinese poet, revered for his lyrical and romantic style. Celebrated for his poems on nature, friendship, and wine.

name: Du Fu
description: Prominent Chinese poet of the Tang Dynasty, known for his social and moral commitment. His poetry is esteemed for its classical form and deep compassion.

name: Xu Zhimo
description: Chinese romantic poet, celebrated for his lyrical and expressive poetry, notably 'Saying Goodbye to Cambridge Again'.

name: Ai Qing
description: 20th-century Chinese poet, famous for his socially conscious poetry, including 'Snowfall in the Dusk'.

name: Bing Xin
description: Chinese female poet and writer, notable for her lyrical works like 'To Young Readers'.

name: Yu Guangzhong
description: Chinese modern poet, known for his works like 'Nostalgia' that blend Chinese and Western literary traditions.

name: William Shakespeare
description: English playwright and poet, often regarded as the greatest writer in the English language. Known for works like 'Hamlet', 'Romeo and Juliet', and 'Macbeth'.

name: Alexander Pushkin
description: Russian poet and playwright, often considered the founder of modern Russian literature. Best known for 'Eugene Onegin' and 'Boris Godunov'.

name: Ho Chi Minh
description: Vietnamese revolutionary leader and poet, with a city named in his honor. His poetry, simple yet poignant, reflects a deep love for his country.

name: Rabindranath Tagore
description: Bengali polymath and a pivotal figure in Indian literature and music. First non-European Nobel laureate in Literature, known for 'Gitanjali' and his profound impact on Bengali culture and literature.

name: Dante Alighieri
description: Italian poet and writer, best known for 'The Divine Comedy', an epic poem that is a cornerstone of world literature and offers an allegorical vision of the afterlife.

name: Franz Kafka
description: Bohemian writer of novels and short stories, known for exploring themes of existential anxiety, guilt, and absurdity. His influential works include 'The Metamorphosis' and 'The Trial'.

name: Lord Byron
description: British Romantic poet known for his flamboyant lifestyle and brooding hero archetype. His major works include 'Don Juan' and 'Childe Harold's Pilgrimage'.

name: Robert Frost
description: American poet, celebrated for his vivid rural imagery and poems like 'The Road Not Taken'.

name: T.S. Eliot
description: British poet, a leading figure in modernist literature, known for 'The Waste Land' and 'The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock'.

name: Pablo Neruda
description: Chilean poet, famed for his passionate works, particularly 'Twenty Love Poems and a Song of Despair'.

name: Langston Hughes
description: American poet and central figure of the Harlem Renaissance, known for works like 'The Negro Speaks of Rivers'.

name: Emily Dickinson
description: American poet, known for her unique, introspective poetry, including the collection 'I'm Nobody! Who are you?'

name: Wislawa Szymborska
description: Polish Nobel laureate poet, known for exploring human and existential themes, as in 'View with a Grain of Sand'.

name: Victor Hugo
description: French poet, novelist, and dramatist of the Romantic movement. Celebrated for his works 'Les Mis√©rables' and 'The Hunchback of Notre-Dame', exploring social injustice and human rights.
